mods.abstract: Creator's handwritten note at bottom of map: 'Plat no.1. City Surveyor’s Office, Baton Rouge, Louisiana, January 25” 1867. At the request of C. H. Roberts, Asst. Quartermaster U.S.A. I have surveyed and taken notes of the present position of the Military Graveyard, and have laid off a proposed plan for the same to correspond with our City Cemetery, as shown on the above “Plat”. The red shows City or Magnolia Cemetery, blue proposed military cemetery, the yellow shows the scattered graves which can be moved in the cemetery. The marks this [hand drawing of a grave symbol] “ “ “ shows the present position of the graves on convention street across it, and out of the corporation[?] and scattered in every other direction. (Sgd.) Clayton B. Evatt, Surveyor & Civil Eng.”'
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Access to unprocessed collections requires the permission of the curator, subject to Special Collections’ Policy on Access to Unprocessed Collections (http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special/about/unprocessed.html)
mods.note: William Waller Survey Collection, Mss. 3592, 3910, 4326, Louisiana and Lower Mississippi Valley Collections, LSU Libraries, Baton Rouge, La.
